stem: The nurse is preparing for a sterile procedure. Place the steps for donning sterile gloves in the correct order.

options.text: Pull the second glove onto the dominant hand and adjust both gloves for fit.
Open the outer glove package and place the inner wrap on a clean, dry surface.
Grasp the inner wrap's edges and open it fully, ensuring the 1-inch border is maintained.
With the dominant hand, grasp the inner cuff of the non-dominant glove and pull it onto the hand.
With the gloved non-dominant hand, slide the fingers under the outer cuff of the dominant glove.

pedagogy.nclexCategory: Safety and Infection Prevention and Control

rationale.correct: Sterile gloving technique maintains the sterile field. (1) Outer package is non-sterile. (2) The 1-inch border of the inner wrap is considered non-sterile. (3) 'Skin-to-Cuff' (Inside of glove is touching skin). (4) 'Glove-to-Glove' (Sterile to Sterile - fingers under the cuff). (5) Finish the application. Keep hands above the waist throughout.
rationale.incorrect: Touching the outside of the sterile glove with a bare hand is the most common break in technique.
clinicalPearls: If you contaminate a glove during the procedure, you must stop, remove the contaminated glove, and restart with a new pair.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Always remember that the very edge of the sterile paper is NOT sterile once you touch it to open the flaps.

reviewUnits.heading: Surgical Asepsis and Sterile Technique
reviewUnits.body: Nurses maintain the sterile field directly in front of them and never turn their back on it. Any object below the waist is considered contaminated.
